label: Description
value: An assymetrical leaf design with thin dashes of gold for highlights. The coloring is very delicate. Printed in ivory and gold on gray field.

label: Description
value: Modified rococo design of green and gold scrolls, sprays of roses are festooned over scrolls. The background is composed of two wide stripes, one gray and the other ivory. Printed on margin: "14, Janeway & Co., 810". Printed in rose, green, mauve and gold on gray and ivory.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle printed with simulation of wood graining. Intaglio printed in black on unbleached paper.

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle, printed in shades of green, with simulation of lawn.

label: Description
value: One patinated bronze triangular mounted plaque (-1a) in original case; three small triangular bronze pins (-1b/d). Each showing classical female figure in phrygian cap, holding sword above her head and striding before rising(?) sun and eagle in flight; inscribed "Victory (in banner above figure), Art, War, Relief"

label: Description
value: One side of an embroidered spectacle case with geometric and floral designs in polychrome silks. Edged with blue braid and fitted at the top with silk ribbon and a pink bead slide.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread, glass bead Technique: embroidered in tent stitch

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 33 x 7 cm (13 x 2 3/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Covering for spectacle case is net embroidered in polychrome silks (tent stitch). One side showing flowers with butterflies and crab and the other, medallions containing people, architectural forms, and flowers, with spaces filled with frets. Case is edged with braid and fitted that the top and bottom with ribbons and beads.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: canvas, silk, glass bead Technique: embroidered in tent stitch

label: Description
value: Band of cutwork in a design of an angular vine with leaves. On one side, a piece of plain white linen cloth; on the other, white fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: withdrawn element work

label: Description
value: One side of a fan case, embroidered in polychrome silks and metal thread (principally knot stitches) in design showing a butterfly, a bird, and an animal with floral ornament. Lined.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: embroidered in knot stitches on satin weave

label: Description
value: One side of a bag, embroidered in colored silks and metal thread in a floral design on a white ground; lined with green and white silk and fitted with a blue and white knotted cord

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal thread embroidery, cotton foundation Technique: embroidered in counted satin stitches on plain weave

label: Description
value: Case of yellow satin, appliquéd and embroidered with a vase and plant in colored silks. Bound in braid and fitted with yellow cord, knots, and tassels.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic threads, glass beads Technique: appliquéd and embroidered in split and knot stitches on satin weave

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (including tassels): 35 x 9 cm (13 3/4 x 3 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Dark reddish-brown print on white ground. Three large vignettes showing scenes from the chase with numerous background figures. First vignette of figures on horseback jumping fence. Second vignette, figures in front of inn. Third vignette, the kill. Printed by Lafosse, Lionnet et Medard.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

label: Description
value: Red print on white ground showing six vignettes from the life of Jeanne d' Arc; including storming a wall, scenes in camp, entry into city, appearance before king, at prayer, and at stake. Ground has all-over design of minute dots and stars.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Large rectangular panel printed in red on white showing pastoral scenes and birds among ruins.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by two plates printed sequentially on plain weave
Systeme de la Mecanique a la Jacquard

label: Description
value: Book written in delicate longhand, unsigned, and with no title page.  Contains 141 mises-en-carte, 104 samples of fabrics, in addition to numerous technical drawings and full notes for loom arrangements and descriptions of many fabrics.

label: Physical description
value: Label: board covers; pen and ink with gouache on paper pages; cotton, linen and silk samples

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Trustees' Book Appropriation

label: Notes
value: Book written in delicate longhand, unsigned, and with no title page. Contains 141 mises-en-carte, 104 samples of fabrics, in addition to numerous technical drawings and full notes for loom arrangements and descriptions of many fabrics.

label: Description
value: Uncompleted book written in delicate longhand, labelled on title page: "Cahier de Theorie 1848".  Contains nine samples of fabrics, 12 mises-en-carte, sketches for heddle arrangements and descriptions of fabrics.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: paper, bound with buckram covered cardboard with vellum back and corners, containing fabric samples and mises-en-carte

label: Dimensions
value: H: 5.2 x W: 34 x L: 48 cm

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Trustees' Book Appropriation
Theorie des Etoffes Unies et Faconnees

label: Description
value: Uncompleted book written in delicate longhand labelled on title page; "Theorie des Etoffes Unies et Faconnees".  Contains 131 samples of fabrics, 99 mises-encarte, numerous sketches for heddle arrangements, technical drawings and descriptions of fabrics.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: paper bound with buckram covered cardboard with suede back and corners, containing samples and mises-en-carte.

label: Dimensions
value: H: 4 x W: 29 x L: 44.3 cm

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Trustees' Book Appropriation
Scenes and figures in the career of Henri IV

label: Description
value: Red print on white ground. Background solidly covered with dome-like motif with diagonal line of hatching, 6 vignettes; 1 - combat between warriors and horsemen; 2 - conference between queen and knight; 3 - parting from sweetheart or wife; 4 - conference near ship and sea; 5 - triumphal entry into city; 6 - group of men in tent in front of a castle.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed on plain weave; red on white ground

label: Description
value: Piece of irregular shape giving full repeat. Opposed interlacing chevrons, set vertically, with rosettes of varying design, in grisaille with accents of cream and white. Grey ground with vermiculation of red.

label: Description
value: Piece of irregular shape giving full repeat. Simulation of rusticated mansonry or ashlar block printed in light brown, dark brown and white, with marbleized effect on rough light grey paper.

label: Description
value: (a) and (c) full widths, (a) giving slightly more than one repeat of design. Scrolled figure set with scattered flowers and foliage, outlined in light blue; background strewn with small rosettes, in diagonal lines, in light blue; b) a small fragment with indistinct maker's mark on reverse. Paper embossed with pebble ground. Printed in blue, greens, reds and gold on blue ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edith and Maude Wetmore

label: Description
value: Drop-repeating design of rose sprays, with foliage, flowers and seed pods. Printed on white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edith and Maude Wetmore

label: Description
value: Full width. Sanitary paper composed of simulated tiles, with green lines marking the squares and three units of design to the width of the paper. Simple radial geometric figure set with foliage scrolls. Printed in yellow-green on plain ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edith and Maude Wetmore

label: Description
value: Full width. Simulation of brocade of Louis XVI period. Wide and narrow stripes of blue and pink, and alternating large and small serpentine vines with flowers. Paper embossed with transverse ribbing. Printed in blue, green, yellow and pink on white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edith and Maude Wetmore

label: Description
value:
Tile pattern, smallish squares with deep blue lines printed on muted yellow ground. Full width. Simulation of tile work, with blue lines, and small blue squares set diagonally at points of intersection.
Blue on paper.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edith and Maude Wetmore

label: Description
value: Aesthetic-style design. Three repeats of symmetrical arrangements of intertwined vines with conventionalized roses, the space between the motifs filled with interlaces. Along top and bottom, narrow bands of leaf ornament set with roses. Paper embossed with pebble figure. Printed in red, blue, brown and gold on red-violet ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edith and Maude Wetmore

label: Description
value:
Full width, giving slightly more than one repeat. Bands composed of wide green and narrow white stripes, enclosing alternating white bands set with wide and narrow serpentine vines with flowers.
Reds, greens, blue and yellow on white-printed ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Edith and Maude Wetmore

label: Description
value:
Portion of an unused roll with figured scenes. Woman in swing hung between two trees, accompanied by man and woman on donkey, accompanied by goat and dog, pointing to ruined building in marsh. Smaller vignettes of hunters and dogs.
White, dark red and brown distemper on grey ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The Imperial Paper and Color Corporation

label: Description
value: Patchwork square made up of diamonds of unbleached and printed cotton. One print has a red ground with small-scale Europeanized cone design with star and plant motifs. Other print has a tan ground with highly realistic design of leaves in shades of brown. On center square in ink is written "Cornelia Bersteen 1849."

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: pieced and sewn patchwork of plain and printed fabrics

label: Description
value: Handscreen with a wide, octogonal silk leaf printed with a still life of neoclassical pottery, fruits, birds and feathers in the late 18th century style. Turned and gilded wood handle.

label: Physical description
value: Printed silk leaf, turned and gilded wood handle

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1939: Gertrude Crownfield; 1939: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Reversible design in green and gold-colored silk of symmetrical pattern in alternating horizontal rows. One row has three tulips crowning a pedestal formed by curving bands that have pairs of confronted birds. The other row has a fountain of a highly stylized animal forms.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound weave
